required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluating a Host-response Based Diagnostic for Distinguishing Between Bacterial and Viral Etiology in Patients With Lower Respiratory Tract Infection (LRTI)
clinical_study.official_title: A Multi-center, Prospective, Validation Study to Assess the Accuracy of a Host-response Based Diagnostic for Distinguishing Between Bacterial and Viral Etiology in Adult Patients With Lower Respiratory Tract Infections

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to validate the diagnostic accuracy of a novel host-response based diagnostic tool for differentiating between bacterial and viral etiologies in adult patients aged 18 years and older with clinical suspicion of lower respiratory tract infections (LRTI)

primary_outcome.measure: To externally validate the diagnostic accuracy of a host-response based diagnostic tool called ImmunoXpert™, for differentiating between bacterial and viral etiologies in adult patients aged 18 years and older with clinical suspicion of LRTI
primary_outcome.time_frame: 0-6 days after the initiation of symptoms

secondary_outcome.measure: To compare the diagnostic accuracy of ImmunoXpert™ to currently available lab measures (WBC, ANC, PCT, CRP), using sensitivity and specificity measures and predetermined cutoffs
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 0-6 days after the initiation of symptoms

secondary_outcome.measure: To compare ImmunoXpert™ results with the physician suspected diagnosis at time of patient recruitment and compared to the reference standard diagnosis
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 0-6 days after the initiation of symptoms

secondary_outcome.measure: To estimate the potential improvement in health and economic outcomes following the usage of ImmunoXpert™ compared to current practice
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 0-6 days after the initiation of symptoms

secondary_outcome.measure: To estimate the diagnostic accuracy of ImmunoXpert™ in differentiating between infectious vs non-infectious patients
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 0-6 days after the initiation of symptoms

arm_group.description: Patients with suspicion of LRTI, excluding episodes of COPD exacerbations
Afebrile patients with no apparent infectious disease
Patients with suspicion of LRTI in a sub-group of patients with COPD

study_pop.textblock: The study population will include eligible patients aged 18 years and older of both genders that attend the emergency department or affiliated community clinics due to a suspected LRTI, or due to a non-infectious disease.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients aged 18 years and older who agree (or their legal guardian agree) to sign an informed consent will be eligible for inclusion.
- The LRTI cohorts should also fulfill the following criteria:
- Peak measured (not tactile, self-reported acceptable) temperature ≥ 37.8°C (100°F) within the last 7 days (AND)
- Symptoms duration ≤7 days (AND)
- Clinical suspicion of LRTI or pneumonia
Exclusion Criteria:
- Oral/intravenous/intramuscular antibiotic treatment of over 48/12/12 hours' duration at time of enrollment (respectively), unless temperature ≥ 37.8°C was measured within the last 2 days
- Another episode of an acute infection during the last 2 weeks
- Congenital immune deficiency (CID)
- A proven or suspected human immunodeficiency virus (HIV)-1, hepatitis B virus (HBV), or hepatitis C virus (HCV) infection
- Active malignancy
- Pregnancy
- Current treatment with immune-suppressive or immune-modulating therapies including without limitations:
- Use of high dose steroids >1 mg/kg/day prednisone or equivalent in the past two weeks
- Monoclonal antibodies
- Intravenous immunoglobulin (IVIG)
- Cyclosporine, Cyclophosphamide, Tacrolimus
- Granulocyte/Monocyte colony stimulating factor (G/GM-CSF)
- Anti-Tumor Necrosis Factor (TNF) agents
- Interferon (of all kinds)
- Other severe illnesses that affect life expectancy and quality of life such as:
- Moderate to severe psychomotor retardation
- Post-transplant patients (including solid organs, allogeneic/autologous stem cell transplantation)
- Moderate to severe congenital metabolic disorder

reference.citation: Oved K, Cohen A, Boico O, Navon R, Friedman T, Etshtein L, Kriger O, Bamberger E, Fonar Y, Yacobov R, Wolchinsky R, Denkberg G, Dotan Y, Hochberg A, Reiter Y, Grupper M, Srugo I, Feigin P, Gorfine M, Chistyakov I, Dagan R, Klein A, Potasman I, Eden E. Eden E, Srugo I, Gottlieb T, Navon R, Boico O, Cohen A, Bamberger E, Klein A, Oved K. Diagnostic accuracy of a TRAIL, IP-10 and CRP combination for discriminating bacterial and viral etiologies at the Emergency Department. J Infect. 2016 Aug;73(2):177-80. doi: 10.1016/j.jinf.2016.05.002. Epub 2016 May 30.

van Houten CB, de Groot JAH, Klein A, Srugo I, Chistyakov I, de Waal W, Meijssen CB, Avis W, Wolfs TFW, Shachor-Meyouhas Y, Stein M, Sanders EAM, Bont LJ. Lancet Infect Dis. 2017 Apr;17(4):431-440. doi: 10.1016/S1473-3099(16)30519-9. Epub 2016 Dec 22.
